title: Setting Up the Proportion
text: The two main variables in this problem is weight of the child to weight of the pain killers. Using the standard pain killer prescription ratio as one proportion and Brianna's as the other one we can set up the resultinig proportion: $$\frac{1}{15}=\frac{6}{x}$$

title: Cross Multiply
text: Cross multiply by taking the numerator of the first expression and multiplying it with the denominator of the second experssion. Then cross multiply the remaining numbers.
speech: Cross multiply by taking the numerator of the first expression and multiplying it with the denominator of the second experssion. Then cross multiply the remaining numbers.

title: Reformatting the Expression
text: Create a new expression by setting the first cross multiplication product with the second resulting in $$x=90$$.
